page.title: 03SWIMMING IN RIVER CALDEW
page.content:
The bay is situated at Bridge End, which is at the southern end of Dalston.
The bay is a popular place where young people go to bathe. It is a weir with a deep pool where you can swim. The pool is about 20 feet deep. People say that many years ago a horse and cart fell in but no traces have been found.
The bay is safe but it has a strong undercurrent and some parents won't let their children swim there. You can go down the waterfall on old inner tubes or air beds.
If you get permission off of the people who own the land you can go fishing there when the season starts.
